name: Information Rules
author: Carl Shapiro & Hal Varian
description: The foundational text on network economics - Varian became Google's Chief Economist

name: Matchmakers
author: David Evans & Richard Schmalensee
description: Rigorous platform economics by two top IO economists

name: Platform Revolution
author: Geoffrey Parker, Marshall Van Alstyne & Sangeet Paul Choudary
description: Most comprehensive platform strategy book

author: Alvin Roth
description: Market design from a Nobel laureate - auctions, matching markets

name: Prediction Machines
author: Ajay Agrawal, Joshua Gans & Avi Goldfarb
description: Best economic framework for AI as cheap prediction

name: Power and Prediction
author: Ajay Agrawal, Joshua Gans & Avi Goldfarb
description: AI's system-level disruption - sequel to Prediction Machines

name: The Attention Merchants
author: Tim Wu
description: History and economics of attention and advertising

name: Subprime Attention Crisis
author: Tim Hwang
description: Adtech's inflated metrics - essential for advertising economists

name: Priceless
author: William Poundstone
description: Pricing psychology and behavioral economics

name: Confessions of the Pricing Man
author: Hermann Simon
description: Practitioner pricing strategy from the world's leading pricing consultant

name: The Age of Surveillance Capitalism
author: Shoshana Zuboff
description: Data economics and behavioral surplus extraction

name: Weapons of Math Destruction

description: Algorithmic bias and fairness - ML economics

name: The Alignment Problem
author: Brian Christian
description: AI alignment with human values - relevant to responsible AI

name: The Curse of Bigness
author: Tim Wu
description: Concise antitrust primer for tech

name: The Great Reversal
author: Thomas Philippon
description: Data-driven competition economics

name: The Platform Delusion
author: Jonathan Knee
description: Contrarian take - when network effects don't matter

name: Radical Markets
author: Eric Posner & Glen Weyl
description: Mechanism design ideas - auctions, Harberger taxes, quadratic voting

name: Uberland
author: Alex Rosenblat
description: Algorithmic management and gig economy

name: The Filter Bubble
author: Eli Pariser
description: Personalization and recommendation economics

name: Invisible Engines
author: David Evans, Andrei Hagiu & Richard Schmalensee
description: Early platform economics - software as two-sided markets
